header: I have started a big thing. At least big to me.
I have started to create a full, beginner level, Perl training course as video and I am offering it through Udemy.

entries.title: Saint Pierre and Miquelon
entries.text: Dave Cross mentions that the island that has the .pm domain name extension is starting to allow registration by anyone in the EU.

entries.title: Beginner Perl Maven
entries.text: Announceing the first online video course I made. This is for people learning Perl. There is a special discount code for those visiting this page in the next day or so. Feel free to invite your friends to use this discount.

entries.title: 3 quick Dist::Zilla tips
entries.text: Oliver Gorwits gave a very short list of Dist::Zilla tips.

entries.title: 6 ways to minimize script startup overhead
entries.text: Steven Haryanto lists 6 ideas. Some are really good though I don't agree with all the strategies. I liked the idea checking the cost of a module using Devel::EndStats (in his pmcost script). Using require for modules that are not used on every run is a clear win.

entries.title: Which Marpa distribution to use?
entries.text: Jeffrey Kegler continous his regular Marpa this time explaining about Marpa. This time he writes about the different use cases of Marpa::XS, Marpa::PP and 'Bare name' Marpa.

entries.title: Parallelism and Test Suites
entries.text: Test::Harness allows you to run tests in parallel which can save a lot of time both during module installation and during testing your own application. chromatic shows a few examples where these parrel tests might break and how to fix them easily.

entries.title: Know split's special cases
entries.text: brian d foy explains 3 special cases of split: The empty pattern, the single space and splitting lines.

entries.title: Dancing the Haka or How to build a LAN radio station in 3 hours
entries.text: Yanick Champoux takes us on a scenic tour with his Maori friends pulling together a streaming server and a web application to have their own radio station.

entries.title: Mojito Simply Does MojoMojo
entries.text: Mateu introduces Mojito, the document engine he wrote.
